Official Website: Not documented (covered under Telangana Tourism / ASI)
Accessibility: Crowded Old City area; steps inside tower; not fully wheelchair accessible
Guided Tours: Heritage walks and local guides available in multiple languages
Special Notes: Icon of Hyderabad, built in 1591, surrounded by lively bazaars.

Accessibility: Moderate climb; not wheelchair friendly; uneven terrain
Guided Tours: ASI guides available; light & sound show in English/Telugu/Hindi
Nearby Amenities: Cafes, food stalls, souvenir shops, restrooms
Special Notes: Famous for acoustic system; Qutb Shahi dynasty capital.

Accessibility: Wheelchair friendly in most zones; large campus with shuttle buses
Guided Tours: Included in ticket; English, Hindi, Telugu commentary available
Nearby Amenities: Restaurants, resorts, shopping areas, entertainment shows
Special Notes: World’s largest film studio complex (2000 acres); family favourite.

Accessibility: Steps involved; limited wheelchair access
Guided Tours: No official tours; local volunteers explain temple significance
Nearby Amenities: Restaurants, shops, Hussain Sagar lake nearby
Special Notes: Built of white marble; panoramic views of Hyderabad city.

Accessibility: Wheelchair access at lakeside; boating not fully accessible
Guided Tours: Boating staff guide during rides
Parking: Available near Necklace Road & Lumbini Park – ₹30–50
Nearby Amenities: Parks, restaurants, street food, shopping areas
Special Notes: World’s tallest monolithic Buddha statue; Necklace Road nightlife hub.

Accessibility: Large stone ruins, uneven terrain; not wheelchair friendly
Guided Tours: Local guides available in Telugu, Hindi, English
Special Notes: Capital of Kakatiya Dynasty; famous for carved gateways (Kakatiya Toranas).

Accessibility: Steps and uneven paths; limited wheelchair access
Guided Tours: ASI-certified guides available
Nearby Amenities: Small eateries, resorts near Ramappa Lake
Special Notes: Built in 13th century, floating bricks architecture; inscribed UNESCO World Heritage in 2021.

Official Website: Not documented (covered under Telangana Tourism & ASI)
Accessibility: Steps and old stone flooring; not fully wheelchair friendly
Guided Tours: Local guides explain Chalukya-style architecture
Special Notes: Built by Rudra Deva (1163 AD); star-shaped shrines with intricate carvings.

Accessibility: Trek of ~400 steps; not wheelchair accessible
Guided Tours: Not formal; local villagers guide during treks
Nearby Amenities: Limited shops, forest rest houses nearby
Special Notes: Highest waterfall in Telangana (147 ft); flows from River Kadam.

Accessibility: Requires short trek through forest trail; not wheelchair friendly
Guided Tours: Local eco-tourism volunteers guide visitors
Nearby Amenities: Food stalls, forest rest houses, eco-huts
Special Notes: Called “Niagara of Telangana”; less crowded, serene forest location.

Entry Fee: Dam view free; boating ₹30–150; Ethipothala Falls entry ₹20
Accessibility: Roads in good condition; limited wheelchair access near dam area
Guided Tours: Boating guides available; history guides in Nagarjuna Konda museum
Special Notes: One of world’s largest masonry dams; nearby Buddhist site Nagarjuna Konda.

Entry Fee: Free; trekking and camping packages priced separately
Accessibility: Hill roads motorable; trekking moderate difficulty; not wheelchair friendly
Guided Tours: Trekking guides and camping tours available
Nearby Amenities: Resorts, campsites, forest rest houses, food stalls
Special Notes: Birthplace of Musi River; popular weekend getaway from Hyderabad.

Accessibility: Hilltop temple; ropeway and escalators available; wheelchair friendly zones
Guided Tours: Temple priests & local guides available
Special Notes: Recently renovated into a grand temple complex; major Vaishnavite shrine.

Accessibility: Wheelchair accessible in main areas
Guided Tours: Volunteers explain church history
Special Notes: Largest church in Asia by capacity (5,000 people); neo-Gothic architecture with stained-glass windows.

Accessibility: Steep rock climb (~500 steps); not wheelchair friendly
Guided Tours: Local guides explain fort’s Chalukyan history
Special Notes: Built in 10th century by Western Chalukyas; offers panoramic views.

Accessibility: Temple area mostly accessible; steps inside main sanctum
Guided Tours: Local guides and priests explain rituals
Nearby Amenities: Lodging, small eateries, shops for religious items
Special Notes: Famous for Akshara Abhyasam (child education initiation ceremony); located on Godavari riverbank.

Accessibility: Forest roads; some trekking paths; not fully wheelchair friendly
Guided Tours: Forest department guided safaris available
Special Notes: Habitat for blackbuck, wild boar, peafowl; also boating on Pocharam Lake.

Accessibility: Wheelchair friendly in main pathways; safari vehicles available
Guided Tours: Guided safari and zoo information available in English/Telugu/Hindi
Special Notes: One of India’s largest zoos; houses lions, tigers, elephants, reptiles, and bird species.

Best Time to Visit: March – April (Rama Navami festival), October – February
Accessibility: Temple complex mostly accessible; main sanctum has steps
Guided Tours: Local guides available; priests provide explanations
Special Notes: Famous Lord Rama temple on Godavari River; vibrant festivals and boat processions.

Accessibility: Forested roads; some trekking around lake; not fully wheelchair friendly
Guided Tours: Local guides and boat rides available
Special Notes: Built in 1213 AD by Ganapati Deva of Kakatiya Dynasty; lake surrounded by dense forests and wildlife sanctuary.
